title.narrative: Mechanism 16704 - One Community (One C)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
To be awarded March 2015, One-C will be USAID/Malawi’s flagship community activity will cover three main programmatic areas: support to OVC, care for people living with HIV, and HIV prevention. It aims to prevent new HIV infections and mitigate HIV/AIDS impact in 8 high prevalence Southern districts, building upon ongoing community work. One-C will implement comprehensive community packages in pri Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.2: Sexual Prevention - Abstinence/Be Faithful. Activities (including training) to promote abstinence, fidelity, reducing multiple and concurrent partners, and related social and community norms that impact these behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

To be awarded March 2015, One-C will be USAID/Malawi’s flagship community activity will cover three main programmatic areas: support to OVC, care for people living with HIV, and HIV prevention. It aims to prevent new HIV infections and mitigate HIV/AIDS impact in 8 high prevalence Southern districts, building upon ongoing community work. One-C will implement comprehensive community packages in prioritized facility catchment areas in designated districts. Interventions will reach OVC households, adolescents, mothers, discordant couples, hard-to-reach populations (migrants, fishing communities), and PLHIV. Linkages and service referrals will be formalized between community and facility sites. Community leadership and structures will be strengthened for cost-effective responses and sustainability. Community mobilization will address harmful gender norms, create demand for services, and address barriers to adherence and retention. Condom distribution will be central to prevention efforts. Age-appropriate OVC prevention, care and support packages will increase pediatric case finding and strengthen resiliency of vulnerable households through family centered interventions, including economic empowerment, social protection, education and food security. In collaboration with treatment partners, index case and targeted community-based testing will maximize case finding and age-appropriate PLHIV linked to care and support groups. Leveraged USG investments in maternal and child health, family planning, education, and agriculture will address multi-sectoral needs of vulnerable families in communities. Evaluation methodologies, including an independent impact evaluation (SOAR mechanism), will assess outcomes.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 1800 G Street, N.W., Suite 10300, Washington, DC 20006

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.

title.narrative: This area of the State Department website contains the standard terms and conditions documents incorporated by reference into all standard grants, cooperative agreements, fixed amount awards, award to individuals, and property awards to U.S. and foreign recipients that are not Foreign Public Entities.
